author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: لَمَّا أَشْهَدُ بِعَجْزِي وَعَجْزِ عِبادِكَ أَسْئَلُكَ بِأَنْوارِ جَمالِكَ بِأَنْ لا تَمْنَعَ بَرِيَّتَكَ عَنْ شاطئِ قُدْسِ أَحَدِيَّتِكَ، ثُمَّ اجْذِبْهُمْ يا إِلهِي بِنَغَماتِ قُدْسِكَ إِلى مَقَرِّ عِزِّ فَرْدانِيَّتِكَ وَمَكْمَنِ قُدْسِ وَحْدانِيَّتِكَ وَإِنَّكَ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ الحَاكِمُ المُعْطِ المُتَعالِ المُرِيدُ،
translation: Having testified, therefore, unto mine own impotence and the impotence of Thy servants, I beseech Thee, by the brightness of the light of Thy beauty, not to refuse Thy creatures attainment to the shores of Thy most holy ocean. Draw them, then, O my God, through the Divine sweetness of Thy melodies, towards the throne of Thy glory and the seat of Thine eternal holiness. Thou art, verily, the Most Powerful, the Supreme Ruler, the Great Giver, the Most Exalted, the Ever-Desired.
